check.description: Confirms that your custom changes have been entered safely, allowing you to generate with an updated or replaced template, or with a changed 'ns.yml' file. Essentially, generates a new version of the code and then simply compares it against your current version.  If there are differences, then there is a problem with your code. For documentation about safe custom code changes, please see https://ns-flip.nostack.net//Safe-Custom-Code.

args.name: codeDir
args.description: directory containing the code to check

contact.description: send feedback or request to ns-flip.  Optionally provide email and other fields.
examples: $ ns contact "how do I set up comment delimiters with escape chars?" -e pauljones123@gmail.com
$ ns contact "generate is breaking when I add handlers."

filediffs.description: compare the files in your sample target code and in the code being generated. In some cases makes suggestions.

codeDir.name: codeDir
codeDir.description: code directory.  Will override the default

sampleDir.name: sampleDir
sampleDir.description: sample directory.  Will override the default

generate.description: generates code based on a template and an 'ns file'.  To set the template, you need the template flag.

templateDir.name: templateDir
templateDir.description: Template directory. Will generate from the template, and will override any prior template or template version used.

noSetup.name: noSetup
noSetup.description: Do not update the startup routine (this is only relevant when the templateDir flag is also used). Saves a lot of time for a template developer.

args.name: codeDir
args.description: directory containing the code to check

sample.name: sample
sample.description: directory containing the sample code from which you want to template
